author: Monish Datta
text: 'Okay so I didn’t get any photos of my food here because it wasn’t very inspiring. Think deli level quality of pancakes
column5: egg white omelet
column6: side of bacon etc. standard deli fare and thankfully at not much higher than NYC deli prices. Bit of a hike to get to if you’re a Manhattan person but good spot with beautiful interiors and tasteful decor for the off chance you find yourself in Hoboken

author: Jason Lopez
text: 'Burger and fries please'

author: Stanislaw Warcholek
text: 'On a 45F night
column5: outdoor seating with heat lamps and a warm spiced cider knocks the ball out of the park. Highly recommend'

author: Paul Verba
text: "Food isn't very good"

author: Nil Cor
text: 'This was my 3rd time and the food is always delicious. Great staff too.'

author: Steve
text: 'Delicious food and fast service. Prices were surprisingly reasonable for the area too. Will be back!'

author: nishant sinha
text: 'Really bad food ! The fries were soggy and the potatoes were over cooked. The Hollandaise sauce on the egg Benedict was not so flavorful. And salmon was also not very fresh. Bad bad experience. I am that basic person who takes photos of my food everyday (even at home) but this was so bad that I was embarrassed To take the picture and post it on my Instagram.'

author: youn hee Hwang
text:
'(Translated by Google) Ok

(Original)
좋아용'

author: Danielle Denman
text: 'Came here for dinner during a bachelorette party. Our original plans fell through but so glad they did because we had such a great time at this restaurant! The service was amazing
column5: from the wait staff
column6: bussers
column7: etc. The ambiance was so nice with the lights and area for outdoor dining. Food and drinks were great! I had the mussels and pommes frites and a couple of Papi’s margaritas. Everything was awesome!'

author: Licia McClary
text: 'stopped in yesterday at 5:00 and was welcomed by patrons who immediately moved over a seat at the bar so we could sit at the bar too!  Always nice way to start out when you come across kind people.  The vibe was perfect for us
column5: friendly people having cocktails and food at the bar.  The bartender Alex was very helpful making suggestions off the menu and offered a taste of his favorite Rose so I could decide what I wanted.  His pick was spot on and so was his food suggestions.  I had the avocado and artichoke salad which is baby arugula
column6: creamy warm and lemon dressing with avocados and artichokes.  Alex suggested adding grilled salmon on top.  Just delicious together.  The salmon was cooked perfectly and made my salad a meal.  Rich had fish and chips with malt vinegar and thin frittes!  He said it was really good.  To top it all off we had the warm double chocolate sundae which is chocolate bread pudding
column7: vanilla gelato and home made whipped cream...WOW... in a word.  The chocolate bread pudding had the consistency of a brownie but not the sugar overload.  Just decadent and delicious.  We both enjoyed the meal
column8: the people and the service was just fabulous
column9: thanks Alex.  We will be back... Just to add this
column10: we went back this Sunday and this time Josh and Rachel took care of us and they were fantastic.  Tried different dishes and loved them as well.  Had the calamari salad which was very different than the usual calamari with red sauce.  I Loved it!  It was fried and added on top of baby arugula
column14: fresh lemon...just delicious! Also had the homemade gnocchi with Bolognese to die for.  Rich had the steak
column15: a side of broccoli rabe and mashed potatoes versus fries and everything was just terrific.  This is a very welcoming bar with a different menu which is just such a welcome change.  Love it here!'

author: Keith Carroll
text: 'Great service
column5: loved the atmosphere'

author: Noa L
text: 'Food was mediocre at best. Calling their restaurant and dishes with a French name does not mean that’s how the French do it
column5: and I’m from France. It was summer
column6: we were walking by in the afternoon
column7: and decided to stop by and eat. First thing
column8: the host said “I can give you this table if you can eat in less than an hour”
column9: so that’s nice. We said yes
column13: but not nasty either. After we ordered
column14: I went inside to use the restroom
column15: and as I left the restaurant to go back to our table outside
column16: I hear the manager say to the host “no more sandal people”. Needless to say my outfit was worth more than his monthly salary and he was wearing Walmart clothes (not that there’s anything wrong with that
column17: just putting it into context). I almost responded something
column18: then I decided “that’s what yelp is for”.'

author: thetrollking1
text: 'We ate outside and it was very nice. Food and staff were very good. We had brunch.'

author: Ed Merritt
text: 'Great food!'

author: katherine brennan
text: 'Terrific ambiance. I really enjoyed the garlic truffle fries!'

author: Lazarus
text: 'Its a French restaurant with great outdoor patio dining on beautiful Washington Ave Hoboken
column5: NJ.'

author: Jhann Heras
text: "Honestly
column5: very few options for appetizers and options for eating. I didn't like it."

author: Jay Gandhi
text: 'Amazing food and drinks and great service.'

author: Sanjana Lal
text: 'Very underwhelming. I had a lot of expectations because it had so many good reviews but the food is below average but the service was good'

author: B. E.
text: 'Cool vibe especially for a brunch'

author: J. B.
text: 'Went for lunch on a Friday and we did not have a reservation but they accommodated it. I highly recommend making a reservation for lunch since it was very busy. The food was delicious although it took a while to come out.'

author: Joseph Chacko
text: "went in for a Sunday brunch. the service and ambience was top notch. i only wish that the menu and food quality was as better. food wasn't worth the $$"

author: Ramona Johnson
text: 'Good service.'

author: Lifestyle With Louis
text: 'The treatment received at this place was below zero stars. Honestly
column5: the manager is what’s wrong. There is no respect to customers even when they do something wrong. The manager didn’t even listen or tried to fixed the situation. I advise others considering this cafe
column6: not to. Go where your business is valued

author: Chantal Guzman
text: 'Absolutely loved this place! First time here today
column5: I got the chipotle marinated skirt steak and it was amazing!! My friends all took bites because of how good it was. Would def recommend that if you order steak from here!'

author: NAMERA 0108
text: '(Translated by Google) I had some potatoes with duck

cheese and delicious truffle oil

(Original)
Comí unas papas con pato
column6: queso y aceite de trufas delicioso'

author: JC1976citadino
text: 'excellent attention from the waiter José.  polite and very attentive at all times.'

author: Alberto Navarro
text: 'I really like this place. Weekends tend to be a bit busy
column5: but their food is amazing. I normally go for brunch on weekends and the service is very friendly and fast! But the best thing of Elysian Cafe is the Irish Coffee they make. IT IS SO GOOD.'

author: Adam G.
text: 'I love the Elysian Cafe. It\'s classic Hoboken and it\'s one of my favorite places to sit outside
column5: have a drink and get good service. However
column6: the food is inconsistent. A perfect example of this was the fish & chips that I had there 2 weeks ago. The fish was perfectly cooked but it had no flavor. The tartar sauce was bland. The fries
column8: were undercooked and not seasoned. The lobster roll was underwhelming in the amount of lobster and taste. The burger was very good. So
column9: go and enjoy Hoboken... and you may love the food or you may say

author: Jill
text: 'The most amazing food! I came back twice in one week. The decor is stunning and the outside seating was so pretty w the hanging lights. Will be back very soon!'

author: Deliz mateo
text: 'Came here for the first time and
column5: sadly
column6: did not received the best treatment. Yes
column7: the manager is not friendly or welcoming. Same goes for the hostess. This arrogant attitude carries through their service
column8: very much as if they’re doing you a favor. Definitely no customer appreciation. Evidently
column9: they don’t care if you leave dissatisfied - you either take it or leave it. Sad!'

author: Sean Andersen
text: 'Brunch was fantastic. Salmon Benedict was superb and the eggs were runny and delicious. Beautiful interior; would recommend to anyone'

author: paula aquino
text: 'The place is gorgeous
column5: yet the food and the service is not. What a shame :('

author: Laurie Quinn
text: 'Beautiful atmosphere
column5: great food
column6: and service!'

author: Katia Polo
text: 'If you look “different
column5: ” expect to be treated differently. This is the best way to describe their service. Manager is super arrogant.'

author: Lucia Nardini
text: "Can't wait to visit again!"

author: PX
text: 'My wife and I ate here recently for an early dinner on a Friday evening and plan to return. We enjoyed the grilled octopus for our appetizer
column5: I had the grilled cheese with bacon and my wife ordered the fish and chips. We each had a glass of vino to pair with our food. Prices were reasonable and the food quality was good. We would recommend.'

author: Ibette Johns
text: 'Manager Chris was a disappointment. This place has so much potential
column5: but if handled the way the manager runs things
column6: there won’t be much positive left. Whenever you talk or approach him he acts bothered
column7: and as if he is doing the Cafe and their customers a favor for being there. Very rude attitude!'

author: P Pouls
text: 'This was our third time at Elysian Cafe. Quite a disappointing experience as a result of manager Chris’ unprofessional and I’ll-mannered behavior. We wanted to get some clarification regarding the parking validation at Little Man’s Parking Structure
column5: where they tell you parking is free with validation from Elysian but at the Cafe they actually charge you. Chris simply rolled his eyes and walked away
column6: yes he turn his back and walked away
column7: in the middle of our exchange. We were sincerely confused as to what might have caused the attitude and reaction - still unclear. In summary
column8: our customer experience was down-hill after that. Chris clearly handle the simple exchange in a very poor manner. Sad that that his actions reflects poorly on the legacy
column10: of the Elysian Cafe. Not a good approach
column11: Chris. His mediocre example then follows down the line to those employees under his.'

author: Ken Bousquet
text: 'Amazing Steak Frites!'

author: Karen G
text: 'First time at the cafe. It was so nice to sit outside. Food was excellent and the service was truly awesome.'

author: yoan ante
text: "Everything is delicious. I've never paid more than 30 bucks for brunch for two people. It's my go to spot for Saturday or Sunday brunch. Wish there was a little more cover on the sidewalk on sunny days but besides that the service is good
column5: the food is delicious and the price is very reasonable. My go to's are the Frisée Salad and the Croque Monsieur. They never disappoint."

author: Dhatrish Rajdev
text: "It's a place where you go (because outside seating is beautiful) before you go to a fabled restaurant for sumptuous and delectable meal.\n\nFood was bland and neither breakfast nor dinner offered satiation of having eaten soulful food."

author: Patricia Cellini
text: 'This restaurant was a suggestion from my grandson who goes to college in the area. The restaurant was busy outside but we chose to sit inside. Even though it was a Saturday afternoon
column5: the only available menu was the “brunch” menu which had more egg dishes than anything else on it. We were greeted by our server and asked for water which took close to 5 minutes to receive. My grandson ordered steak and eggs with “Lyonnaise” potatoes otherwise known as home fries and I ordered poached eggs Florentine which was similar to eggs Benedict but with spinach and Hollandaise rather than ham. I also ordered the lyonnaise potatoes. I’m not sure if his food was cool when it was served but mine certainly was and I received French fries which had to be sent back for the correct potatoes.\nThe “best” part of this experience was when the smoke alarms went off in full blazes and couldn’t be shut off until the fire department arrived!\nNo type of compensation was offered for the inconvenience which made the temperature of the food even more unforgivable.'

author: james matthews
text: 'Good food and ambience.'

author: Allison Serries
text: "Of the three times my husband and I ate at this restaurant
column5: everything we ordered so far was delicious. We thought that we wouldn't get full because of the smaller portion size
column6: but we were surprised. One of our favorite restaurants in Hoboken."

author: A Cooper
text: "Came here for Sunday Brunch at 1000. We made a reservation
column5: but I don't think there was a wait based upon the open indoor and outdoor tables. There is adequate parking on the street. You can ask for crayons to color on the paper table cover which was a highlight. The food was pretty yum
column6: we tried the avocado toast
column10: and the egg white omelet. The french toast was the best. We needed some more salt and pepper on the rest. For 5 plates
column12: it was just over a hundo. Not bad. I don't think I'd come back but if you want a decent breakfast  with good service

author: Jacob Conklin
text: 'Good breakfast in a beautiful town in New Jersey'

author: Visionary Module
text: "Best water I've ever had"

author: Michael Panayiotou
text: 'Alex was the man behind the bar and made me feel really at home. I appreciate this bar a lot. Great food great cocktails and a bunch of hospitality. Thanks guys!'

author: Joseph Chung (Joe)
text: 'Great service. Not my go to place for lobster roll.'

author: Yana S. Moss
text: 'My favorite restaurant in Hoboken ❤️'

author: Carolina Furió
text: 'Amazing place!!!! Love the food and the attention!!! My favorite restaurant in Hoboken! Very taste food and when I bring my dog they are very cute with her 💜💜💜💜 I’m recommending this place 100%'

author: Roger Grebe
text: 'Favorite spot in Hoboken'

author: Angel Reyes
text: 'Great place to eat. Outdoor tables on a great main street for people watching.\nLimited menu
column5: but the few items on the menu are good. They also have a kids menu if you need one. Overall great food and ambience.'

author: Gabriel Cueva
text: 'Lovely setting & amazing food! The grilled octopus and onion soup premier plats were delicious... the gnocchi and the chicken breast - so tasty! The Amelia cocktail is refreshing !!'

author: Jo Hayes
text: 'A little slow on lunch service but the food was tasty!'

author: Noémie
text: "This was disappointing. Instead of poached eggs we got hard-boiled eggs
column5: which seems like such a rookie mistake. All 4 eggs were hard-boiled
column6: so either the cook doesn't know how to make a poached egg or doesn't know what it is. Avocado toast was served on a slice of plain white bread. The restaurant itself is cute

author: Alicia Lester
text: 'Super authentic
column5: reasonably priced and delicious. 10/10 would recommend.'

author: Cooper Brennan
text: 'I LOVE THE SHORT RIB OVER JALAPENO GRITS! great fries and great staff! Burgers are cooked very well! One of if not best casual restaurant  in Hoboken!'

author: Hany Wissa
text: 'Excellent'

author: Preetika Vattikundala
text: 'Great place for breakfast. Pancakes were so fluffy and the lyonnaise potatoes were delicious. Will definitely visit again.'

author: Connie Xu
text: 'Yum! Brunch at Elysian is 10/10. Fast service and delicious food. My only complaint is that I swear the fries were better two years ago (the last time I was there) but overall delicious still. The portions are large and you get what you paid for. Would recommend in general if you’re looking for a nice place for brunch.'

author: Dessie Hristov
text: 'Very cute little restaurant on a corner! Food is amazingly good. Everything we tried was fantastic. The poutines is one of the best I have ever had. Charcuterie board has some good variety too. The miso salmon was to die for! Definitely try the creme brulee - so incredibly good! Definitely call ahead for a reservation! Recommend!'

author: Mark Lavery
text: 'Food was served hot & tasty.  Barman Josh is top notch.'

author: David Wilder
text: 'Historic Bar and Grill. Active outdoor seating. Interesting architectural details. A few quirks
column5: like why is the Lobster sandwich only on the Dinner menu?'

author: Hakan Mansuroglu
text: 'Very authentic place to chill and relax.'

author: Joe Maneira
text: 'The cocktails are 🔥🔥🔥'

author: Gizem Acar
text: 'Very nice place with good food. Their burger is so tasty and juicy.'

author: Alisher Yuldashev
text: "Great place
column5: good food
column6: good service. Can't complain. Recommend to go there."

author: Sarah Basmadjian
text: 'Great ambiance! I came here for a lunch date. The menu has something for everyone'

author: Roxanne
text: 'Good food
column5: quick service'

author: chris kay
text: 'Beautiful place food has improved and is reasonable.only knock is the drink prices are very expensive.'

author: Donna Battisti
text: 'Quaint vibe we stopped for lunch.  Lunch was very good
column5: with decent portions
column6: service could be better.  We will go back to try for dinner.'

author: cristina marin
text: 'I love this place!'

author: iris luna
text: 'The place is great but the today the coffee was bad'

author: Joseph Diaz
text: 'Always loved this place. Very relaxed atmosphere awesome bar and good food. Service is always excellent.'

author: Megan Gillen
text: 'Went here for outdoor dining a few weeks ago. The poutine fries as an appetizer were fantastic and we also each got pasta dishes for our dinner. The food itself was great
column5: but we ate around 8:30pm so it got pretty cold and windy as we were eating. Unfortunately we weren’t at a table near the heat lamps so we ate half of our entree before heading home to keep warm. I would definitely go back for the food/atmosphere but recommend going when the weather is nicer.'

author: L. Jason Smith
text: 'Best bacon in the world or at least my world. Miss having an Irish coffee at the bar with Tommy...but the outdoor dining is very comfortable!\n\nWaited 30 minutes after being told that the 6 outdoor tables were for people who had reservations. After being seated
column5: waited 15 minutes for waitress to take our order. Minutes later she returned to inform us that we could not order from the Brunch menu because it was after 3:00 pm...it was 3:06 pm.\n\nAs a someone who was there every weekend for the last few years I was beyond disappointed and will not be back.'

author: katerine pileggi
text: "the host's attention is lousy"

author: BOGOFLO
text: 'Amazing food and service!!!'

author: Jonathan Posada
text: 'Fantastic service and food.'

text:
'!!! fraud !!

Elysian cafe offers a glass of wine for $9 and then charges $10.

the manager behaves hostile and does not apologize
column5: only informing that they will correct the bill'

text: 'Great place to people watch

text: 'Excellent food

text: 'Great food

author: B&O5300
text: 'Great food with kind staff set in a turn of the century bar which had always been open since that time
column5: Prime Rib sandwich and fries was one of the best fills you up pretty well.'

author: meghjeet vartak
text:
'Food is Ok
Ambiance is great.
Ordered fried calamari was 9/10
Cocktails are also 8/10
Really helpful and friendly staff.'

author: AJ Lagomarsino
text: "One of my favorite restaurants in Hoboken for takeout or outdoor dining. Staff is quick and professional. Food is absolutely delicious. If you're there from brunch
column5: I recommend the steak and eggs."

author: Kimberly Lindman
text: 'The food tasted pretty good but not worth the food poisoning or $$$. Probably won’t eat here again.'

author: Jonathan Pepe
text: "I love the Elysian
column5: it's just loaded with old school charm--the tin ceilings
column6: the retro wood bar
column7: and the clustered bentwood chairs and marble cage tables. The front room is an intimate venue for cozy couples and local revelers. The back room
column9: is open and airy often popular with groups or families. Outside seating during nice weather is so pleasant and reminds me of European cafes. The food is delicious classic brasserie fare
column10: delivered by well seasoned staff. Cocktails are excellent
column11: they have a nice selection of beers on tap
column12: and a short but sweet wine list. Nothing is too fussy or expensive. Two for one night is a gem!"

author: alexandra pedreros
text:
'(Translated by Google) Super and beautiful place

Super y el lugar precioso'

author: Mariela Rodas
text: 'Good'

author: Max Di Biaggio
text: 'Great place and I would love to play there.'

author: Kornelia Jablonska
text: 'Delicious food definitely worth trying. And very friendly service.'

author: Parvathy Ajit
text: 'Excellent Service and Tasty Food'

author: Xauen Zirpolo
text: "Lot of great brunch places in Hoboken
column5: and Elysian is no exception. Decent prices with very solid portions
column6: great bellinis and bloody marys
column7: bottomless coffee- just about everything you could ask for! I got the steak and eggs and it was terrific- had a bite of the french toast and it was equally yummy. I'll be back."

author: Diego Perez
text: 'Great food'

text: 'Good quality food.'

author: Ron Latz
text: 'Have been here so many times I’ve lost count. Food quality and service has always been consistent. Great spot for a quick drink or to watch a game as well.'

author: howard prince
text: 'Nothing great'

author: Simon Woodford
text: 'Very good quality cafe
column5: their food is good
column6: the location is good and the staff is friendly and professional. I love this place.'

author: Arnaldo Abreu
text: 'Recently dined at Elysian and was somewhat disappointed. The service was almost nonexistent. Had to ask different staff members multiple times for basic items: tableware
column5: napkins
column6: water
column7: etc. They did not appear to be short-staffed and it was not busy at the time.\n\nThey should rename the restaurant "Pommes Frites Cafe". The majority of dishes our group of four ordered
column8: had French fries as the starch accompaniment. No variety there.\n\nThe food was tasty
column9: but did not excite. My favorite was the Poutine appetizer
column10: very flavorful.\n\nWith so many restaurants in Hoboken to discover
column11: don\'t think I\'ll be going back.'

author: Ed De
text:
'Good food & quantities
Ratatouille was excellent

They have water for puppies

For Covid-
Outside seating
column5: possibly not exactly 6 feet apart all sides
column6: but hopefully the outside air helps mitigate any issues\nSanitize tables and chairs on leaving\nNote - we also had got a high chair but on cleaning it I found stains on the surfaces indicating that it was good that I cleaned it up'

author: Carin Buckman
text: "The food today wasn't up to par. My $30 halibut was tasteless
column5: my decaf was water and they charged for refills and the service was terrible. The waiter had a poor attitude and was not at all pleasant."

author: Joelle Eberhart
text: "Just wow. Amazing food and not overly expensive! I would have expected to pay more for the type of food and atmosphere. Service was also timely and very good. I was so pleased to be enjoying such quality while not going broke
column5: will definitely return. Can't wait to try breakfast!!"

author: Betty Buffin
text: 'Wonderful and charming! Great food!'

author: J T
text: "Sadly
column5: not what it used to be. Since a change in ownership a couple of years ago
column6: this Hoboken bistro has gone downhill fast. Service is painfully slow
column7: management is disorganized and the food is not what it used to be. And don't blame the pandemic. It's descent into mediocrity began long before Covid. It's a shame
column9: because it used to such a great place."

author: robert Lara
text: 'Best place for eating'

author: Y L
text: 'Absolutely nothing to write home about. While it looks cute to enjoy a casual meal outdoors
column5: service is mediocre
column6: food is blend and it leaves much more to desire for dining in Hoboken. Definitely first and last time here.'

author: Nicholas Currie
text: 'Best lobster rolls in Hoboken'

author: Pablo L.
text: 'First time coming here and I have to say the food was amazing. Everything was cooked to perfection
column5: the scenery of the restaurant was very pleasant to the eyes
column6: and the staff was attentive.'

author: Jacob M
text: 'really good brunch! had the steak and eggs and it was delicious'

text:
'(Translated by Google) Exquisite food in this beautiful place

Exquisita la comida en este bello lugar'

author: Musa Aguirre
text: 'We met with friends at this place for dinner. This place was recommended to us by a friend.  Well
column5: it was very nice. the staff were so friendly and we felt very good. The food was just great. We enjoyed every moment and we shall definitely come back again. Recommended.'

author: Kris M
text: 'Great food
column5: Excellent drinks and just a pleasant environment'

author: Bellee M
text: 'I like the bloody Mary.  Food was good even though it took so long to get it.'

author: Raveena Kannan
text: 'Loved their ambience. Dinner got cut short because of rain but I loved the calamari salad the boxed up for me.'
